header.title: Welcome to JUEL!
header.meta: Unified Expression Language, Unified EL, EL, JUEL, javax.el, JSP, JSF
JUEL is an implementation of the Unified Expression Language (EL), specified as part of the JSP 2.1 standard (JSR-245).

body.p: JUEL is an implementation of the Unified Expression Language (EL), specified as part of the JSP 2.1 standard (JSR-245).

section.title: Motivation
section.p: Once, the EL started as part of JSTL. Then, the EL made its way into the JSP 2.0 standard. Now, though part of JSP 2.1, the EL API has been separated into package javax.el and all dependencies to the core JSP classes have been removed.
In other words: the EL is ready for use in non-JSP applications!

section.title: Features
section.p: JUEL provides a lightweight and efficient implementation of the Unified Expression Language.

ul.li: High Performance – Parsing expressions is certainly the expected performance bottleneck. JUEL uses a hand-coded parser which is up to 10 times faster than the previously used (javacc) generated parser! Once built, expression trees are evaluated at highest speed.

Pluggable Cache – Even if JUELs parser is fast, parsing expressions is relative expensive. Therefore, it's best to parse an expression string only once. JUEL provides a default caching mechanism which should be sufficient in most cases. However, JUEL allows to plug in your own cache easily.
Small Footprint – JUEL has been carefully designed to minimize memory usage as well as code size.
Method Invocations – As an extension to the standard, JUEL can be configured to enable method invocations as in ${foo.matches('[0-9]+')}.

VarArg Calls – As another extension to the standard, JUEL can be configured to support Java 5 VarArgs. E.g., binding String.format(String, String...) to function format allows for ${format('Hey %s','Joe')}.

Pluggable EL– The JUEL jar has been setup to be transparently detected as EL implementation by a Java runtime environment or JEE5 application server. Using JUEL does not require an application to explicitly reference any of the JUEL specific implementation classes.

section.title: Status
section.p: JUEL is considered production stable. The code is well tested and feature complete.

section.title: Availability
section.p: JUEL is licensed under the Apache License 2.0.

section.title: Requirements
section.p: JUEL's EL implementation (packaged into juel-impl-2.1.x.jar) depends on the javax.el.* API. An el-api-1.x.jar (taken from GlassFish) is included in the distribution.
